thread.title: Amazon launches Business, Industrial & Scientific store for 3D printing supplies
thread.title_full: Amazon launches Business, Industrial & Scientific store for 3D printing supplies

title: Amazon launches Business, Industrial & Scientific store for 3D printing supplies
text:
Amazon launches Business, Industrial & Scientific store for 3D printing supplies 22 September 2015 Expand Amazon.co.uk has launched the Business, Industrial & Scientific Supplies Store featuring more than half a million industrial products including 3D printing and additive manufacturing supplies from 3D Systems and XYZprinting . 
The new store includes lab and scientific products, professional medical supplies, power and hand tools, janitorial and sanitation supplies, occupational health and safety products, tapes, adhesives, sealers, measurement and inspection devices. 
The 3D printing inventory includes desktop machines, filaments and various parts from over 50 companies like Ninjaflex, rigid.ink, Floreon3D, Robox, Printrbot, Flashforge and many more. 
“We’re delighted to offer business owners a great selection of supplies and products at great prices, all in one store,” explained Raoul Heinze, Director of the Business, Industrial and Scientific Supplies Store for Amazon EU. “With fast and reliable delivery, essential equipment can be restocked at the click of a button, allowing customers to focus on running their businesses.” 
Other leading brands available in the store include 3M Industrial, Kimberly Clark Professional, DuPont, Horiba, Adam Equipment, 3M Littmann, 3B Scientific, Wheaton, Heathrow Scientific and many more. 
Oskar Kaszubski, Global Director, Commercial Innovation, Kimberly-Clark Professional, added: “We have high expectations for the EU launch of the Business, Industrial & Scientific Supplies Store, having seen years of success in the US.” 
The Business, Industrial & Scientific Supplies Store is available on Amazon.com, Amazon.co.jp and Amazon.in and launches today on Amazon.co.uk, Amazon.de, Amazon.it, Amazon.es and Amazon.fr. Tags
